{"step_by_step_thinking": "Lead poisoning inhibits several enzymes in the heme biosynthetic pathway, including delta-aminolevulinic acid dehydratase and ferrochelatase. This results in the accumulation of the substrates of these enzymes. Delta-aminolevulinic acid is a substrate for delta-aminolevulinic acid dehydratase, so its levels would increase in the blood.", "answer_choice": "D. Delta amino levulinic acid"}
